{{DISPLAYTITLE:Polyobj_OR_MoveToSpot}} {{Special|59|po, speed, target|Polyobject|MoveToSpot, OR}}
Moves a polyobject in a straight line towards a given destination.
* ''po'': polyobj to move * ''speed'': how quickly the polyobject should move, in map units per [[octic]]. * ''target'': the tid of the [[:Category:Map spot|spot]] to which the polyobject should move.
The “OR” in this special stands for OverRide. Under normal circumstances, if a [[polyobject]] is doing something, you cannot make it do something else until it has finished whatever it is doing. This can be a problem with perpetual polyobjs (such as [[Polyobj_RotateLeft]] or [[Polyobj_RotateRight]] with a [[Definitions#Byte_Angles|byte angle]] of 255). Using one of the "OR" specials, you can force the polyobj to stop whatever it is doing and do something else.
